item.description:
@Jython wrote:

dbLoadImage() only takes Windows bitmap files I believe (.bmp). Try with this:

[br][br][size=1]Posted on: July 23, 2009, 06:39:01 pm[/size][hr]Nevermind… I’m a moron. You need to draw the image, via dbSprite() or dbPasteImage() I believe

item.title: C++ Picture?
item.dc:creator: @tyman33 tyman33
item.description:
@tyman33 wrote:

Here is my code…

#include “DarkGDK.h”

void DarkGDK ( void )
{
dbSyncOn ( );
dbSyncRate ( 60 );

SetCurrentDirectory ("Media");
dbLoadImage ( "Evil.png" ,1 );

while ( LoopGDK ( ) )
{
	
	dbSync ( );
}


return;

}

for some reson when i Debugg and run it doesnt appear , Can someone help me?

Read full topic
